page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: All of the land in our area was used for farming. There was hardly any land for industry. The land is almost all used for crops. These crops include potatoes, cabbages, sprouts and cauliflowers. Also we grow wheat and barley. Nowadays we grow a lot of oil-seed rape because the Common Market pays good prices for it. In October, there is the sugar beet harvest and lorries take the sugar beet to the factory at Spalding. The only grassland is on the re-claimed marsh and around some of the large houses. Sheep are kept on the re-claimed marsh. The school owns a patch of land near the Hobhole where the Freiston butcher keeps his animals.
